text: here at everyday food we're all about
creating recipes that are simple and
delicious and if possible with lots of
variations so you can make it however
you want and today's recipe is no
exception it's a cookie recipes that you
can vary however you like today I'm
going to make chocolate chip version but
I'm going to share some other great
combinations with you in a few minutes
after I get started the first thing you
need to do is measure to a quarter cups
of all-purpose flour 1/2 teaspoon of
baking soda and 3/4 of a teaspoon of
table salt the fine salt whisk it
together
those are your dry ingredients make sure
you have your oven preheated to 350
degrees and then you can start the
creaming process I have 2 sticks of
unsalted butter here add I'm going to
add 3/4 of a cup of packed white brown
sugar and then 1/2 a cup of regular or
white sugar cream this up turn it on
using a handy dandy hand mixer today
handy dandy make sure that it gets nice
and light and fluffy usually when you're
using light brown sugar it won't get
really fluffy but because this is a
combination it actually will and then
stop your mixture and add 2 teaspoons of
pure vanilla extract even the vanilla
extract and then add the eggs one at a
time you always want to add one egg
feeding to incorporate after each egg
recipes call to do that because it just
makes it easier for it to fully
incorporate before you add the next egg
you certainly could add all the eggs at
once but it won't be as good and now
it's time to add the dry ingredients add
your flour add it all at once and then
start very slowly to beat it
you don't want to go flying everywhere
which is going to want to do if you turn
your beater on too high and then just
beat it until everything is combined and
at that point it's time to add your
mixes and you'll see what I mean
remove the beaters and just make sure
you get all the dough out of them and
now for the fun part this is where you
get to be creative you can do what I'm
doing today chocolate chips and pecans
or you could do rum soaked raisins and
cat
tsch√ºss peanut butter and cherry if you
use in the peanut butter you add it with
the butter Oh chocolate chip and toffee
chips oat coconut and lime and those are
just some of our favorite combinations
and you'll get all those recipes online
but today on our classic combination of
chocolate chips 2 cups which is one
whole bag of the chocolate chips and one
cup of toasted chopped pecans mmm chippy
and nutty chippy nutty the dough should
be soft enough that you can easily stir
these mix-ins in and then stir them in
and then all that's left to do is scoop
and bake scoop onto parchment lined
baking sheet you can either use 2
tablespoons or just use a scoop if you
have one it's about 2 tablespoons per
cookie and these are going to bake up
into sort of like a puffy cakey cookie
as opposed to sort of a flat crunchy
cookie so they're not going to spread
too much so you can put about 8 on each
baking sheet if you wanted to you could
shape them like this and then throw them
all into a resealable freezer bag and
put them in the freezer and then
whenever you want fresh cookies you can
just take them out and bake them off
bake the cookies at 350 degrees rotating
the sheets top to bottom and
back-to-front about halfway through 12
to 14 minutes so once they're baked you
just want to slide them off the baking
sheet on the parchment paper onto a
cooling rack and let them cool and if
you can resist eating them until they're
completely cool you're a better person
than I am
YUM this cookie has got it going on
you're going to have it going on if you
make these cookies bury it up however
you like and if you make new variations
write us in at Facebook and tell us what
you did send us pictures send us
variations and maybe one of these days
I'll make your recipe
